author: perama
content:
Pseudocode aside, I think the list percentiles should be "nearest rank, inclusive"

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Frequency_histogram_and_exclusive_and_inclusive_percentiles_2.png

Plus a final extra value at the end of the list for the maximum

author: perama
content: But maybe what we need is a set of test cases

author: zsfelfoldi
content: You are right, i wanted to write the nearest rank inclusive version but looks like the check is in the wrong place, should be after the addition. Thanks, i'll fix it :)

author: perama
content:
I made a transaction generator and graphed some dummy results from your API <@!202397237962211328> 

https://github.com/perama-v/fee-history/blob/main/viz.ipynb

It simulates the part of the API where you specify the list of percentiles you are interested in. I also included a
comparison of gas-weighted and non-weighted versions.

Everything looks good AFAICT.

author: perama
content:
Where the blue gas-weighted percentile calculation diverges from the yellow count-based method. 

This is the result of a very large transaction

author: perama
content: Which can be seen here as the outlier at about 58 gwei/gas

author: perama
content:
So, the API returns the blue rather than the yellow in general

It is more of a philosophical design choice. I think it works, and see no obvious problems.
